result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David L. MOON

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
State moves to dismiss and read in. The defendant plead to charges in 15 CF 222 and 15 CF 291.  Motion granted.
Minutes.

Defense counsel was just recently assigned to these cases, he has not reviewed all materials.   Plea date reset to 12-11-15 at 2:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
Motion and Order allowing Matthew J. Kollell to withdraw as counsel of record.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 07-17-15 at 2:45 p.m.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 06-02-2015 at 11:30 a.m., Br. 2.

Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 03-20-15 at 2:30 p.m.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of disorderly conduct and obstruct officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-09-15 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $450.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs in any location.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
